issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

Ever since this commit, if you use Titanium Developer to launch an application into the Android emulator and then later close the emulator (with Developer still running), you get a "red" error message and python traceback in the Developer console (see screenshot).

[ERROR] Error in compiler. Traceback (most recent call last):     File "/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/DEV_1.5.0/android/builder.py", line 1502, in <module>     s.run_emulator(avd_id,avd_skin)     File "/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/DEV_1.5.0/android/builder.py", line 389, in run_emulator    sys.exit(rc)   SystemExit: 0
{html}
fields.summary: Android: Error message displayed to Ti Developer user when emulator is closed

comments.body:
{html}

(from [85f74c106fce74ce317ed0dd291425a2ced6046c]) [#2460 state:fixed-in-qa] Catch and 'pass' (i.e., ignore) SystemExit when it's the exception in the big outer try block at bottom of builder.py https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/commit/85f74c106fce...

{html}
